Fields.DialogueText: Wareware wa, I-7 tomosu. Yoroshiku onegai shimasu.
Watakushi wa Kanchou desu. Yoroshiku onegaishimasu.
I'm pleased to meet you, I-7.
Well met, Kanchou. You stand in the presence of I-7, J3 class submarine. Hora, chanto ojigi shite kudasai.
(*The Captain politely bows.*)
(*I-7 politely bows back.*)

Fields.MenuText: I feel as if I've entered an office meeting.
Is there a major event today?
I can tell this is going to go along well.

Fields.DialogueText: Hahahaha! Worry not for now. You shall learn all our courtesies in good time. For now, I deem some training appropriate.
Not today, Kanchou - when it's time for Hinomatsuri, it will be quite obvious! Until then, though, we practice.
Ah? Honto desu ka? We've only just met. Though, I must admit, you seem capable of upholding your own honor. Take heed, Kanchou. Our training shall be rigorous.
Do you have something specific in mind? Target practice?
Sore wa chigai masu, Kanchou. A true warrior must first learn the way of the sword if they are to command one such as me in battle. Prepare yourself.
Can we at least use bokken? I don't want any of us getting hurt.
Hai, mochiron desu. Of course I shall provide you with a bokuto. We shall begin our practice post haste.
I believe our actual practice may have to wait, I-7. There appears to be a Morgana coming this way.
Ha? Kekko desu. Let me show you this ship's power, then. Issho ni ikimashou, Kanchou. Let us greet them with sword.
Sounds like a plan.
@BATTLE
Hu! (*Schwing!*) Hei! (*Schwing!*) Ho! (*Schwing, swoon!*) Hyah! (*Schwingschwingschwing!*)
I believe that training dummy is as good as dead, I-7.
Be that as it may, my faithful retainer, my work is not yet complete. To be peerless, we must practice until our every motion is as sure and natural as the currents of the sea.

Fields.MenuText: I'm a retainer now?
Wood doesn't bleed, does it?
I will admit, it's quite beautiful watching you.

Fields.DialogueText: Mochiron desu. What is the Kanchou but the ship's most honored attendant?
Anything can bleed if you cut it deep enough. That is the essence of our style. A sword upon foe / Overconfidence without / Our soul in balance. This is our creed, retainer. Learn it well.
Dou? Kirei desu ka? Arigatou. I have been training for my whole waking life. My sword is unmatched by any demon; my skill is without question. Observe, and learn from my actions, retainer.
I believe I can learn much from you, I-7. I hope you learn from me.
And what do you have to teach? I concede that you commanded us well in the last battle. You have shown some strength. But, in the end, you're still human. Your limits are not mine.
Hai. You did command us well, but I think you lack... vigor. You need to improve your strength, your stamina. Otherwise, you shall be outmatched in battle.
I suppose so- hm? Wait a... Ah! I-7! DOWN!
Oah!? (*I-7 moves out of the way.*)
(*A Morgana shell hurtles into the waters and emanates a loud *BOOM!*)
Whew! That was close! Glad I caught that. Are you all right, I-7?
Kah... Bikkuri... Grgh! Bikkuri shimasen deshita! Retainer! With me!
I-7, are you blush-!?
Kaguko shite yo! We will not stand for this insult!
Agreed.
@BATTLE
And so the training dummy shall be made to bleed.

Fields.MenuText: Heh. Point.
Let's agree to disagree.
Your commanding officer.

Fields.DialogueText: No?

Fields.MenuText: You sound awfully biased against humans.
One thing I can teach you is not to assume you know other people's limits.
That's verging on insubordination, you know.

Fields.DialogueText: That was not my intent. But I have a role in battle that you just can't fill.
Hm. Well said, I grant you.
You do concede that my directives in the last battle were effective?
If we strike from here... no? Doko desu ka..? Doko ni utteshimasu ka? If we could just...
What's up?
A-Ah! Kuso... (*Under breath.*) Retainer, you would doth well to not sneak up on us when we are practicing.
Sorry. I wanted to know how you felt about Kure. We're here, after all.
We have arrived in Kure already? That was quite fast.

Fields.MenuText: It's a very nice port. A lot of space around here.
I've heard the sunsets are to die for.
Do you think they sell good ice cream around here?

Fields.DialogueText: As it should be. Kure is where the Emperor, his highest majesty, may allow heaven-sent decrees to cross oceans. That is our proud Kure.
Oh, yes, they shine like Amaterasu's final blessings upon the land. This is Kure.
Ice cream...? What is this ice cream? Is it some sort of Western desert?
I had no idea Kure was this impressive.
Sou desu ne. Kure is incredible. We hath spent many of day staring at the clouds above, practicing under the midday sun, and feeling the sea breeze upon our armor. Tis beautiful.
Do you think that I could learn stamina out here? If Kure is the inspiration that you say it is...
I believe you have potential, retainer. But do not assume that Kure simply gives. (*I-7 pulls out a fan and smacks it at the Captain.*) Tatte!
I suppose you want to practice now, I-7?
Do not let your guard down, retainer. Your foe may land the first of many strikes like... so! Hyuh!
(*The Captain rolls out of the way!*) I may not have the stamina, but I have the foresight.
Keh! Mada mada... If you should entertain the thought of keeping pace with me, then you shall stand resolute!
Unfortunately, I will have to stand later. But, I will show you my power this time.
Nani? What do you mean by- Wha!? Mou ichido ka!? More of these impudent..!! Bah! I shall run you through!
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: It is.

Fields.DialogueText: It is where I was built, you know. A beautiful place that grants succor to the entirety of Nippon.
Regardless, if it is appropriate and good, I'm sure it is there to be found.
A warrior needs to be vigilant. Thus the way of the blade must needs be embraced. A soul seeks balance. Thus I shall lead the others into battle...
... Kita!!
(*The Captain hastily dodges a strike from a Bokuto.*) What was that for!?
Eeeh!? My retainer... Erm. Sumimasen. I have been practicing within the shadows to hone my art. Tennen Rishin-ryu wa muteki desu yo. My style is absolute.

Fields.MenuText: In the dark? Isn't that, you know, dangerous?
Isn't that the sword style of the Shinsengumi?
Kondo Isami used that art...

Fields.DialogueText: A true leader works on their weaknesses and smites them with an unbridled fury. Hast not you done the same? This is the essence of true practice. We are alert.
Indeed. We have an odachi at our disposal. With the sword, we shall balance, and untie both mind and soul together. Can you sayest the same, retainer? We are alert.
Seka desu! It would seem that our retainer is more well read than what was previously observed. Still, Isami-dono's doctrine demands that we remain prepared and vigilant. Art you, retainer?
Surprises get the best of us, I-7. Sometimes no matter how much we do prepare, we'll end up getting surprised.
Dame desu yo. Weakness shall lead you to complacency. If you wish to be complacent, then your head will surely appear on the pike of your foe's yari. Do you insinuate that I may be surprised?
There's nothing wrong with being surprised. It forces us to adapt.
Adaptation is the corpse of proper planning, my retainer. If you should plan ahead and tend to all your needs before the battle is bequeathed, victory is assured.
I respect your opinion, I-7. However, no one, not even the Morganas, can know everything. Holding yourself to an unreasonable standard will only hurt you.
Honki desu ka? You speak from experience, yet your swordsmanship is poor. How would you stand against the scornful winds of battle when holding a bokuto proves cumbersome?
Don't underestimate me. I have a lot to learn with the sword, but adaptation, flexibility, and ingenuity win battles.
Heh. Kore wa tsumaranai desho. Your reasoning is faulty, like that of a-
(*An explosion rocks I-7, causing her to fall over.*)
Damn! They got the drop on us! I-7, move! We've got to act now!
Kugh... Naze desu ka? Why? Kuyashii... Not... fair... (*She says under her breath.*)
Stand up! I promise, we'll get through this!
@BATTLE
Ojyama shimasu, Kanchou. Pardon my intrusion.
Ah. I-7-san, konnichiwa. How are you feeling? You were... fairly upset the last time I saw you.
We... I... must... (*I-7 prostrates herself.*)
What is this, I-7?
Moushiwake gozaimasen, Kanchou. My apology may fall on deaf ears, but I implore you to hear my deepest regret. I grew too cocky, and-

Fields.MenuText: Okay, please stop bowing.
People make mistakes, I-7.
A leader must be humble, for they are still a student.

Fields.DialogueText: Kanchou, I have made a great error. Daijobu ja arimasen. Because of my lapse of judgement, many souls could have met Yomotsu Shikome. My negligence is my own downfall. A true leader wouldn't...
Yes, people do, Kanchou. But I as a leader, as a submarine above the rest cannot bare to make such mistakes...! Leaving myself open like this invites your enemies to ravage our numbers: unbecoming!
Kanchou... You would use my own doctrine against me? ... Who are you, really?
I'm a captain. I'm a leader. But leaders allow themselves to live and learn. A mistake is only a mistake. We must learn from them.
In battle... this is a matter of life or death. The smallest mistake could be something that I cannot walk away from...!
I-7, listen. A Captain and a Belle may be responsible for their soldiers, mechanics, medics, and everyone else under their banner. But they have to fail and adapt to truly become great.
Kanchou... What if our warriors should meet their untimely end?
Leaders must not be negligent, I-7. However, they must be humble and be willing to accept that not everything should go perfectly.
Kanchou, would you think less of me less if I asked you to teach me about these ideas?
Not at all. Before we're warriors, we're both students, I-7. Now, let's work on our first lesson: expecting the enemy... 40 degrees north.
W-Wha!? Yoi me wo motte imasu ne! You possess clarity! I would not have spotted that if I were deep in meditation.
Ready to go?
Wakarimashita, Kanchou. Junbi ga dekita desu yo. I am ready. Let us engage!
@BATTLE
Shitsureshimasu, Kanchou.
What's the matter, I-7? You look excited.
Hai. I have received orders from the Minister of the Navy.
Well, that's... auspicious. What does he need?
He sews a report most troubling; the sea devils are causing Ryukyu much suffering. If this should proceed as it steadies, the consequences could be quite drastic. Our task is to reduce them to ash.

Fields.MenuText: Aces. Looks like we get to test our might.
I cannot imagine how the people of Ryuykyu are suffering.
... The IJN got their blocks knocked off, didn't they?

Fields.DialogueText: Hahaha! Sou desu ne. I must confess, my swords ache for the blood of sea devils. Yet, still more, I look to see my Kanchou prove to be a capable warrior.
It brings heartaches. My soul weighs heavy at the thought that those of the distant sea's kingdom are suffering. We must  cull the weak-willed sea devils at once! Are you prepared?
Iie, Kanchou. It would appear that the IJN busies themselves with other matters. Their efforts are lent to the divine, for Amaterasu blesses us with sun and steel. Despite that...
Despite "what?" Nan desu ka? Is something the matter, I-7?
Iie. Iie... Forgive mine impudence, Kanchou. I simply thought of another matter that may... may come back to... Ergh. Please forget it. I wish to see you prove yourself in battle, Kanchou.
There will be plenty of time to prove ourselves capable once we get there. When do we depart?
According to the document, it appeares that we need to make haste. Isogimasu.
We're probably going to face a lot of resistance. This letter's worded pretty urgently.
What do you make of Ryukyu's circumstances, Kanchou?
From what this letter says, it's terrible. I agree with the Minister - we'll get some more supplies and then depart.
... Kanchou, I sense a maleficent presence.
Looks like we're not the only ones in a hurry to do things.
All submarines at my command! Hora, hora! Zenshin yo!
@BATTLE
(... Kirei desu. Mecchya kirei desu yo. Like silken flowers to a newly knit kimono.)
I-7, could I please get your opinion on this battle plan?
(My heart yearns... The sky's deep blue heart, ten no umi ga aishiteru yo...)
(Sometimes I dream of yonder blue's splendor... If only I could just touch-)
I-7, please wake up!
Yaaaah! K-Kanchou! S-Sumimasen... Forgive my impudence, I was looking off into the clouds.

Fields.MenuText: I've never seen someone look at the clouds so intently.
They are pretty beautiful.
Your eyes were sparkling beautifully just now.

Fields.DialogueText: Kumori desu. The clouds on Nihon's sea are unlike any other, Kanchou. Be wary, one may get lost in their soaring white loveliness.
Ii desu ne? Are they not? Mine own adventures have shown me that the skies near Kagoshima and Niigata are the most beautiful. Such unbridaled loveliness.
Arigatou gozaimasu, Kanchou. I *have* been told that my eyes do sparkle when I should gaze upon true beauty - be it the graceful lines of my sword or the clouds in the summer sun.
I think what you see in the clouds I might see in the sea itself.
K-Kanchou, mou ichido itte kudasai. Please say that again, I must confess, that sentence confounds me through sound.
Oh! It's kind of a tongue twister, isn't it? You think the sky inspires you with beauty, I think the sea does that to me.
Eh? And what do you see when you look into the water?
For me, it's freedom. There's only so far that you can go by land. I think the sea holds so much mystery - it intrigues me. Does that make sense?
Hmm... Perhaps I should observe the sea with fewer preconceptions. It seems so easy to be dulled to its scope since I spend each day upon the water.
You'll never know until you look- out!!
Kitta! Hah! I saw through that, this time. Oberu ta zo! Come, Kanchou, let's give it a good fight!
@BATTLE
Mitte iru... All of them, circling around and loafing about like children on Fuyusamui... Our work is not yet done, what mad thoughts guide them? Idiots... Especially that-
Sulking about, I-7? That isn't usually like you.
Tell me, Kanchou. If you looked upon your own men and saw them engaged in meaningless mummery when there is a mission at stake, what would you do?

Fields.MenuText: I-7... we're on patrol.
Gently remind them to keep a head on their shoulders.
I'd consult you first.

Fields.DialogueText: Wa-!? Hah. Omoishiroi jodan. A good jest, you would make a fine yose for parliament. You are the Kanchou, the leader; from you comes discipline. You should reprimand the oaf and get them hence!
Gently!? Yassashiku!? Iie. Iie! Kanchou, you must stand firm; you must assert yourself as the leader! It is your will that shall lead warriors to victory, you must not falter!
You appear to be under the misapprehension that because it is a menial task, no great dedication is required. Chigau! You are a leader! Act so, lest your crew turn into mere gamblers.
Tell me, I-7, have you heard the phrase, "you catch more flies with honey than you do with vinegar?"
I have not. Is that some sort of gaikokujin idiom?
Indeed it is. Basically, you treat your people with respect, and they'll be more likely to listen to what you ask of them.
Loyalty *is* respect, Kanchou. Without loyalty, your men will abandon you to fates unknown. Without loyalty, an army may not function.
Loyalty is important. But respect to those who have already gone through hell is paramount. I wager the COs have already made everyone here go through it. Regardless, camaraderie is as important.
Thy reasoning is suspect. Respect is only earned from those who prove themselves in battle. Any given to those who have not is either done out of disrespect or for pity.
I will be honest, I-7, that's not a good day to look at it. What would you do if you screwed up and I yelled at you?
I would prostrate and apologize as is customary. My error is sin, Kanchou.
... Ah, I see the problem. I-7, could I implore to talk with you for a moment about something. I think that- Oh, look what just came in the mail.
Hmph! More fools to taste Koukinjitsu's power.
Shall we?
Hai. Ikkimasho!
@BATTLE
Zenshin! Mo zenshin yo! All of you, keep advancing! Keep your guards up!
I can see why the Minister wanted us out here this fast. It's bad.
Mecchya mazui desu. I've only cut through three of these witches and yet they insist on making a racket louder than Yatagarasu's squawking.
How about we earn ourselves some peace and quiet?
Ii ne. This shall shape up to be a fine battle. Prove your honor to me, Kanchou. Yoroshiku onegai!
@BATTLE
The rest of them are retreating? That's... unusual.
(Kanchou made them flee... Suge.) Hahaha! Mada mada hashiru na! Do not flee in cowardice, my sword still yearns for you!
While I appreciate your enthusiasm, I-7, we have a situation.
What situation- Ah. (T-The port town is...)

Fields.MenuText: I've never seen a port in such a sorry state.
So many ships in the bottom of the bay...
You were wonderful, I-7, but...

Fields.DialogueText: Nijuuni. Kuh... to lose 22 ships in such a small engagement is regrettable. More than regrettable, such things make my heart seethe with embarrassment. Gommenasai, Kanchou.
Gufu ni ikkimashita ka? It appears as if a typhoon has wrought havoc... This is horrid. 22 brave ships now sit within the sea's embrace, and many soldiers are still unaccounted for. Kuh... If only I-
A-Arigatou gozaimasu, Kanchou. Still, it is quite regrettable that this has transpired. Had I been quicker, I might well have saved another ship. Instead, 22 have been pulled under. Mazui...
Please don't kneel, I-7. Raise your head. There is only so much we could've done in battle. What matters now is what we can do to help the people.
But if we had-
I-7. What's done is done. Come on. Let's go help the people.
(Kanchou... Could you truly be correct? But what of the people...? I have never been told..?) Hai, Kanchou. Please, lead the way.
It would appear that... (*Huh!*) The witches have not learned their lesson yet!
Volley! Turn 90 degrees... volley again!
I can see the fire in your eyes, Kanchou. You (*Huh!*) do not (*Shia!*) disappoint! Show me more of that!
Well, if you and the Morgana want it, you've got it! Full speed ahead, we're going to take that one at 120! I-7, ready to engage?
Kakugo yoroshii desuyo! With my Kanchou, together!
@BATTLE
(Freedom and harmony. Liberate the warrior's spirit. Sea to sky.) ... You cannot escape! Ooooooryah!!! (*SLICE!*)
!!! Did she just bisect that Morgana..? Holy...
Hmph! Mo ichi do! Rise again if any of you wish to meet the Enma post haste! ... Hmph, I yought not.

Fields.MenuText: I have never seen a Belle do THAT.
(*Applaud I-7*)
Beautiful.

Fields.DialogueText: The sword is a reflection of my power. A reflection of my soul! I... Ahem! Arigatou gozaimasu. P-Please do not waste such pageantry. Such things require much practice; it is only natural.
A-Ah... (*I-7 bows*) Arigatou gozaimasu. Arigatou gozaimasu. Kanchou, your praise is... please. I hath done only what needs be to protect Ryukyu. Please. This praise is too much...
C-C-Chotto...! (Kanchou said that so earnestly! Damned... Why would they say that like that!? No. No! I must regain mine composure, less I show weakness!) Ahem... Arigatou gozaimasu, Kanchou.
That was incredible! Your power was known to me, but if anybody else doesn't know about it; now they do!
Kanchou... I must prostrate myself!
No, no! I-7, this is what I'm talking about? Don't you feel great? That's what letting your soldiers and warriors know that they did good.
So... So I hath been made aware... Arigatou gozaimasu, Kanchou.
And, while we're there, how about we check to see if they have ice cream we could get our hands on? Maybe chocolate?
Doko ni iru? I am quite curious to try some myself... with you, of course.
Listen, I propose we go back to port.

Fields.MenuText: We may be able to help out.

Fields.DialogueText: Hm... Ho hum. This spot seems correct. Here now, Kanchou. Please seat yourself.
Why are we in the engine room? Is something going on?
It is not what *is* going on, but what will be, Kanchou. I must ask your forbearance, but - did you see a Morgana off of port side?
I did. According to navigation, it was at 140 degrees and then it was about 50 meters from the bow. But once we saw it, it went away. Why do you ask?
Aha! Tell me then, Kanchou. Do you know why I am submerged?

Fields.MenuText: Because you wanted to cool off?
Did you see a proper funayurei? A real ghost, I mean?
Ambush?

Fields.DialogueText: Uahahahaha! You insinuate me as boiling hot? Hanasunaidekudasai! Do not talk to me as if I am such things. No, there is an explicit reason why I am down here. And it involves an ambush.
I-Is there one? My eyes did not behold one prior, but if there is, I would dare dream to cross swords with it. Call me mad or a daiyabo, if you wish. Ma, I am down here because of an ambush.
Katta. It would appear my Kanchou is quite adept at picking up on things. Yoi. Omedetou, Kanchou. Omedetou. Well done, you have seen what I see!
How did you see it coming..!? I couldn't see any Morgana around for the life of me.
That is why you must indulge yourself in battle more often. Once you have become accustomed to the blade and the flow of battle, the more you shall gain. I was able to sense the Morgana.
How did you do that? Could you please teach me?
Pah! I will not teach you. Oshiemasen! You must put your deeds aside and feel the flow of battle. Be in tune with your soul, and your enemies will walk into your blade like rain falling from the sky.
Hm. Maybe the midshipmen were right, I should invest in a katana.
U-Uah!? Why would they suggest something like that when you cannot wield a bokuto correctly!?
They know I have the ear of an excellent teacher?
Ua..!? Hrrngh... Hmph! I shall begin to teach you after this battle. Those hapless ducks above us are in for a surprise. Shall we surface, Kanchou?
Oh, I would say so. Prepare to surface! Ready salvo!
Hahaha... Ageru da yo! I'll give you a watery grave!
@BATTLE
It's an educated guess. I can't see a thing.
Good. Now. To hold one's blade is to hold one's soul within their hands. Spread your feet. Flex your shoulders.
Huph... Like this?
Ii ne. Perfect. You catch on rather quickly, Kanchou. Kanshin shiteimasu. You are impressing me. But now comes the test.
Right. So, you want me to strike that dummy sideways?
Hai. Hidari ni migi. Strike it from left to right.

Fields.MenuText: I don't think I can slice this thing in half with a bokuto.
Is there a particular way I should swing it?
*Hold the bokuto in a quick draw position.*

Fields.DialogueText: M-Matte! Chotto matte yo! Kanchou, that is impressive, but please, hold! That is a few steps ahead from where we are at now. Simply strike from the left to right as hard as you can, please.
From left to right. Please do it as hard as you can. If you must, lean into your strike. It shall increase the force on which you apply to the dummy. Steel yourself, and strike hard!
If you could, then your skills would be on par with Musashi. But, no one, not even the most esteemed masters of the blade can even hope to match him. Do your best, Kanchou. Strike from left to right.
All right, here I go... Hah! (*Fwoo..!*) (*BAK!*)
Hm. Yoi. Good. Now this time, migi ni hidari. Strike from right to left.
Huh! (*Fwoop!*) (*BAK!!!*) Oh? I knocked it over!
Hm, hmhmhm. Un. You have excellent force. However, your technique needs work. You struck both times with hesitation.
The way the ship is rolling is throwing me off. Forgive me.
Iie. Kekko desu. `Tis fine, Kanchou. But! Remember that battle is in itself is a test of spirit. Any sense of weakness, and your foe will strike you down. Show strength, show soul.
I will. Okay... I'm ready to try again.
Yoi... Don! Begin!
Huuuuu! (*THWACK!*) Wow, it buckled!
There! Kita! That is what I am referring to, your skill- Uaaah!? You spoke truly before, Kanchou - the seas are turbulent today.
That's not turbulence, that's an attack. Looks like it's time to really show my attentiveness in battle!
@BATTLE
Come! Kitte yarou! Thy blood shall sate my steel and will let it gleam in the sun!
That's kind of brutal, I-7.
Naide! Expect nothing less for those about to meet their end by the blade.
Hm, well, it seems like this is our last group of Morgana. That ambush earlier really did a number on them.
"Do a number..." Nani? Is that another one of those expressions you referred to prior?
Hai. It basically means to really get someone good, or to deal some big blow.
Hmph! When I finish this battle, they'll not have any numbers to remain with. Kanchou! Jikan desu! Time's up! The attack begins now!
Orders are my thing, I-7. But I wholeheartedly agree!
@BATTLE
Hah... Undou shimasu..! An exercise beyond compare..!

Fields.MenuText: Extraordinarily well done, I-7.
I'd like to see them try to threaten Okinawa now.
That was... kind of easy, actually.

Fields.DialogueText: A-Ah! Arigatou gozaimasu, Kanchou. Yoku yatta yo. You have done exceptionally. Within that battle, you commanded me as if I were a peerless warrior.
Pahaha! Mou ichido! They won't try that any time soon, lest they wish to end up like that one Morgana from last week. I shall slice until naught remains; my sword is sated. Well done, Kanchou.
Fuhahahaha! Mou, warui kedo... I am forced to admit, that was quite simple. However! It was made simpler by your command, Kanchou. You hve impressed me greatly.
Hey, now. I was only doing what you helped me to do.
Fuhahaha! Honto ni gaikoku hito desu ka? You have exceptional manners, even still. My praise is with you, Kanchou. Exceptional work.
Kind of you to say, I-7. Now, Okinawa is doing better. Perhaps we should celebrate?
Hai, Kanchou. I shall prepare the... what is the word in English? Here we call it "osake."
"Alcohol." That's the word you're looking for.
Nani? It sounds so uncouth! Iie. I shall refer to it hence as osake, even still. Come along, Kanchou! A celebration awaits us!
Ikkimashou!
Kanchou! I have come up with new battle plans regarding- Oh. Shitsureishimasu. I did not mean to interrupt- Wait. Matte. What are you playing?
Oh, hello, I-7. I had some downtime from drawing up routes, so I decided to past the time by playing Solitaire.
Sou... Sou.. ri.. teiru..? Nani? What is this Souritea? What are those, cards?
Playing cards, to be exact. Right now I'm playing a closed game.
Playing cards...? I have never seen such things. They look like Hanafuda...
Remind me to play that one day with you. These are playing cards, I-7. You have four "suits" or colors with symbols and then there are usually 13 cards per suit. 52 cards - 54 if you count Jokers.
Why does this lady hold a rose like such? Why are there two of her? She's upside down..?
Queen of Diamonds, I-7. You see the suit in the top left corner and then the mark of the card itself just above it. That's Q, that means "Queen" in this context.
Such strange depictions... Why play with kings and queens? Is that not disrespectful? Dishonorable?

Fields.MenuText: They're just cards, I-7.
If this war has taught me anything, it's that sometimes authority figures really are cards to be played.
They're less royalty and more like Hikari.

Fields.DialogueText: You must show respect to those on high! Cards... Cards are... Hm. (*I-7 looks about.*) If they are just cards, then perhaps I can overlook the slight...
Why do you think that you can simply not follow rules!? ... Though, what you have there looks quite satisfying. Perhaps...
Ah! Haaah... Hm. Twould be the first I've heard of such cards matching up with the Hikari. Hontoni? Hm... Kanchou, I believe I must gather more information. These cards are... interesting looking.
Would you like to observe, I-7? Solitaire is pretty satisfying when you get the hang of it.
Aaaah... Hmph! Iiyo, kekko desu. Show me how this machination functions. Onegai shimasu.
Hai. Well, you see this here, right? This is the 10 of Clubs. Now, I can only stack this card on the appropriate suit, I can't mix unless if it's a different type of game. So- Wait... something is...
Nani? What, Kanchou?
Prepare for battle, I-7. Something's coming.
Uaa!? Kanchou has improved on picking up things!? I-I was... I mean I... Urk, let's meet them!
@BATTLE
Huh... Kireina... Ureshiyo. Such nights are indeed the time for celebration.
What are you doing up here all by your lonesome, I-7?
Kuh!? Kanchou... are you secretly capable of presence concealment?
I don't think I am. Wow, that's a pretty moon.
Hai. Kore wa Mangetsu desu. That is what you refer to as a full moon. `Tis a rarity to spot one this clearly on the water.
It's incredibly beautiful. I tell you, this would be a good night to lay back and drink some coffee while just watching it.
Kanchou... Tell me of your splendor of tsuki.
Say that again, please?
What feelings, what impressions does the moon inspire in you?

Fields.MenuText: It keeps the light at night.
Makes me feel nostalgic.
I like seeing it sparkle on the water.

Fields.DialogueText: Hm, I suppose that is the most reasonable answer. Indeed. The moon is responsible for guiding sailors and soldiers alike across the fields of night; or what dreams they may have.
No... ru... staru... Kore wa nanto iu imi desu ka? What does that mean? ... Thy face suggest it hath something to do with feelings.
It's about memories of a place or time that holds significance to you, I-7.
Ah... Sou desu. It would be remiss of me to forget Kure so easily. I believe such a place invokes feelings within my soul, as well. Arigatou, Kanchou. Ah, beautiful.
Ii desu ne. It is perhaps one of the most beautiful scenes that I may think of. I do yearn to see this sight every now and again. For the moon reminds me of a time when all mysticism is laid bare.
Truly, you'd be crazy not to think this is a pretty sight. ... I-7, your armor...
Eh!? Is something the matter with it!?
No, not at all. In fact, it's sparkling in the moonlight. You're like a tiny moon, glowing radiantly on the water. Look at all of those sparkles out there!
E-Eh!? Eh..!? S-Sou... (Why are they so earnest!? Nandayo!?) Wait... Kanchou! Some of those are NOT sparkling! They are eyes! Morgana are here!
Then it looks like we'll have a fight under the moon, just like in some legends.
Hah..!!! Yoi! Yoi! I will not waste this chance!
@BATTLE
(...What sound has roused me from my practice? I shall seek it out.)
Hm... So this is A, that's B... Hm, and if I strum it like this, it creates a short chord. Interesting...
Kanchou! Where is that noise coming from!? I am trying to- ... Kore wa shamisen desu ka?
Yep. A local from Yakushima gave it to me as a present. I've picked up some of the basics.
Urusaiyo! You are noisy. Please, Kanchou. I am trying to practice my strokes.
Please permit me then to practice a bit more. I'll be quieter.
How can one be quiet with a shamisen? Such a distinct sound would rouse anyone from such places.
Hm... All right. I'll practice one more chord and leave it at that. Let's see now... E, E, F... E, E, F...
Ah..! They taught you "Sakura, Sakura," did they!?

Fields.MenuText: Wait, it has a name?
It's a very pretty song, I'm just not good at it.
They said it'd be a good beginner point.

Fields.DialogueText: Wha!? Of course it does! It is perhaps one of the most known pieces of music that the glorious Nippon has to offer! I would love to see you master it. But, please practice after I am finished!
Madamada! Kanchou, such practice with such an elegant song will take such tender time to master. Please, do not feel bad about it! Practice if you will, but, please wait until I am finished!
Indeed, they showed you well. 'Tis the "hallmark" of beginners. However, I implore you to wait till I am finished practicing. I... I would teach you of the shamisen as well. If you would permit me!?
Understood - and thank you, I-7. I'll wait to practice after you're finished. I'd be delighted if you joined me afterwards as well.
W-Well! If you wishes to extend an invitation to me, then I will be glad to take it!
Oh, I think I have another invitation for you, I-7. You see, radar's picking up some guests. How should we greet them?
To chikara, Kanchou. We shall greet them with our strength!
I can get behind that. Oh, while were in battle, can you teach me how to hold it without stubbing my fingers? I've done that a couple times.
Hnrrrk! K-Kanchou! This is not... (*snickering*) I-Ikkimashou!
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: Very few of the basics, if I'm honest. It's a process.
I'm really tempted to try to bring a proper tutor into the crew, actually.

Fields.DialogueText: Could be good for morale - and not just for the people who have to hear me practice. *twang*
Hey there, I-7. What are you looking out for?
... Are the other submarines gone?
Yeah. I-66 left with the others a while ago to perform some patrol at Kitakyushu. The locals over there were a bit worried.
Uaaah... Kitta, kitta, kitta. I may finally... (*sigh*)
That was a pretty loud exhale. I-7, daijobu desu ka?
Oh, iyo, Kanchou. I am more than fine. For now I may finally get the chance to relax myself.

Fields.MenuText: Relax yourself? You mean you haven't been?
Why did you wait this long?
Is I-66 bothering you?

Fields.DialogueText: I cannot relax around my peers, Kanchou. They would think me weak. I cannot have that, no matter what. Now I may finally be free and true to my own self!
Because I do not wish to share my freedom with my comrades. If were to do this in their presence... Hmph! Baka deshou. Those fools would not begin to understand me. For this time is my own.
Pah!? I-66 wa jinrokuda. That clumsy submarine is not worth the trouble. The only thing she's capable of is being incapable and annoying. But she won't annoy me now. Now I may indulge.
Is... Is that a surfboard?
Correct, Kanchou. Say hello to Tairanami. Do you find it beautiful? I have crafted it myself.
I haven't seen a surfboard in a long while. Do you... surf, I-7?
Hai, Kanchou. I am quite good at surfing. Henceforth... observe!
Oh, she actually just dove into the water...!
Uahaha! Tanoshiiii~!
Man, look at her go... Just shredding all of those little waves... Woah! She just hopped over that rock like it was nothing! Was I-7 always this good at surfing?
Art you looking, Kanchou! This big wave shall be wonderful...!
That IS a big wave. Hopefully she's careful...
Suuuuuuu~!
... Oh, that's what made that wave.
@BATTLE
Yoisho! Haha, the waves are quite good today...
The sea's been rather restless. Do you think I-66 might be in trouble?
That Jinroku... She is by all definition air-headed but is by no means a non-capable fighter. I wager she will get out of that situation one way or another.
If she's not back by sundown, HQ will throw a fit. We'll have to go get her, and then...
Nonsense! She will lead her squadron back to us wiyout much delay. Of this, I am confident. For now, I am content to enjoy my waves.
How long have you been surfing, I-7? You seem quite good at it.
I have been surfing since my creation. Shikashi, safingu wa nadamerumasu. It soothes me, to control my movements on the water so freely... What about you, Kanchou? What dost you do for... shumi?

Fields.MenuText: Well, I do practice things I like.
I study.
I drive as a hobby.

Fields.DialogueText: Hai. I have seen you with the shamisen, and you have practiced shodo. I recognize your skill with a brush, but must chide you on the shamisen. Still, all in good time.

Ah! You are not lazy like that Jinroku! Your time is spent in service to worthy ideals. I have seen your shudo as well - though I encourage you to invest in a new brush. Remember! Renshu! Renshu! Renshu!
Wha? Kuruma no shimi? What wouldst you even do in such a hobby? Drive about? Hold races? Repair cars? ... Though, this does explain your expert handling of us, so far.
It's all about finding what you love and practicing it to the best of your ability. Wouldn't you agree?
Soudesu. By taking enjoyment in a hobby, you opens yourself to a world beyond simple concepts. Such things are- oh! Wooooaaa!!! Dekka!
Nani? Oh. Oh that's a big wave... Wait! I-7, hold on! You don't know what's in that-!
TOTSUGEKIIIIIIIII!!!!!
Ahh... Rough. I wonder how long it'll take her to realize that-
You utter KNAVE! How dare you invade my wave!? Bukkuro SHITE YARU!!!
Pfft...
@BATTLE
Hai! Tatte! Respond to me and answer faithfully!
Hai, Shihyo! Kikkimasu!
Who do we fight for!?
His Imperial Majesty, the Emperor Upon High who heavens must greet! Tenno Showa!
And what is our creed!?
Hai! Tennoheika Banzai!
Mou ichido itte! Scream it louder than the Shisha!
TENNOHEIKA BANZAI!!!
Osu! Raise your swords, and prepare for another day of holy war! Hai! Owarimasu!

Fields.MenuText: You're quite captivating.
We need more enthusiasm like that. Especially on the home front.
Haha! You could rouse a sleeping beast with such a voice.

Fields.DialogueText: Ha!? Kanchou, how long have you been there?
Oh, Kanchou, ohayo gozaimasu. Hai. I do wish every nation in the world would begin the days with radio broadcasts such as that. Fighting spirit, like fire, must be steadily fueled!
Eh!? Ah... Arigato gozaimasu, Kanchou. Thy praise is unnecessary. I simply follow the path of command - to inspire, rally, and fight.
You're wonderful! Though I feel like if I addressed my staff like that, I'd get some awkward stares.
Then they clearly do not know what respect is! Such shall be the doctrine of true warriors. Kanchou, I encourage you to invigorate!
You invigorate me, I-7.
N-Na..! (Blast it. Why are you saying such...) Arigatou, arigatou.
Oh, hey, looks like your submarines may get a chance to show off. Look at who's coming!
Wha!? Hum! So, the ducks have come with their swords again, looking for an early grave!? Submarine yo! Hora! Zenshin!
OOOOOOOSUUUU!!!
@BATTLE
Long enough to have heard you deliver a heck of a speech.
It is only my duty to offer inspiration to those under my command. I-It is how I invigorate them!
Eh? What do you have there, Kanchou? Tegami desu ka? A letter?
It's from the Minister of the Navy.
Eh? Whatever he wishes of us, I stand ready.
He said we're being assigned to guard duty. There's a festival in Kure, and-
A festival! Then, no wonder some of that letter is in ridiculously casual language. Which festival are we attending..! Uaaa..! Tanoshimi!
Well, the letter refers to lanterns and little boats...
Ah! Bon! Shudo is talking about Bon! Ah, Kanchou. You will simply fall in love with the festival. On my honor, this is true.

Fields.MenuText: Are you okay, I-7? You're kind of...
Will we get to make our own lanterns?
Should be a lot of fun.

Fields.DialogueText: Forgive my impudence, Kanchou. Such a festival is for reverence, but it also holds significance to a shachihoko such as I.
Uaaa! Such memories... If we may manage to protect the festival well, we may have time to work on such things. I would be glad to teach you, my honor, as a shachihoko.
It is! The festival is mostly reverence paid to ancestors, but many wondrous sights abound. Lanterns, amazing food, and the beautiful odori of it all! Such a time for a shachihoko.
You're a shachihoko? Fish body, tiger head?
It is as much who I am as this human form, Kanchou. I am she who protects you from fire and shields you from harm.
Well, I feel incredibly safe.
You should. I am incredibly capable-
Ah! I-7! Morganas incoming!
Come on! Let's fight!
Like the one on your helmet?
Like me.
@BATTLE
Haha! The music! The energy! Surely such revelries are to be indulged in! Don't you agree, Kanchou!?
We're mostly here to defend the place. You know that, don't you?
I... pah... do! But I cannot contain my excitement. For when festivals come around, I feel... free!

Fields.MenuText: What is it that's so freeing to you?
I must not be a good captain if you don't usually feel that free.
Ah, well, might as well join in.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't you feel it, Kanchou? The crisp, afternoon air, the voices of people young and old rejoicing, and the ever-present feel of belonging! This festival is where barriers are broken!
Sore wa chigaimasu! That is not true! Though you have an undeniable amount of work ahead before you reach your full potential, you are nonetheless an exceptional Kanchou! The festival is special!
Please do! The spirits shall become more lively with your participation! Do you see it, Kanchou? This is a time for celebration! I-I'd love to share it with you!
This is a nice festival, actually. Tell me, what else is done at Bon?
Not... oft... This festival is to honor one's ancestors, to show reverence of times past, and to enjoy yourself in their presence!
I wonder if I could talk to my ancestors here, too?
If the kami will it, and you bringest an offering worth great merit.
Sounds novel! But, what should I give them, I-7?
Food, of course! Make something within the mess hall, and go near the shrine. That way, spirits shall be appeased. I... I would aid you, if you so wish it.
I do, I-7. Thank you.
Hai! Let us press... !!! Kanchou, dost you feel that?
I do. There's an evil presence about. How about we show our ancestors that we can still kick as much ass as they did back then?
Kikku asa...? Nani? What dost that mean?
I'll tell you later!
@BATTLE
Do we draw fortunes?
Oh, Kanchou, look at that!

Fields.MenuText: Oh, those kimonos are so pretty!
Wow, there are a lot of lights.
That's the biggest smile I've ever seen you make, I-7.

Fields.DialogueText: Good eye, Kanchou. Each kimono is beautifully handcrafted - especially for this festival, no less! To honor the kami and the ancestors is to honor yourself. Look! Odori!
They're there to light up the night with love and to show reverence to kami and ancestors alike. The golden light brings fortune and favor to those showing appropriate respect through the odori!
Uaaa? Fu... I cannot help it, Kanchou. My happiness for the festivities and for the golden gleam of the lights and the oncoming Bon odori...
Oh, odori! I was hoping we'd get the chance to see some dancing!
Ma, ma. This freedom is only for this festival, Kanchou. I am a warrior. A true maiden of the sword whose work will never be done.
I-7, while I admire your commitment, you shouldn't put everything on the sword. In card games, we call that going all-in - but you shouldn't do that every turn.
Kanchou, with all due respect, a warrior without a sword is like a peasant without their work, or merchants without their gold. It cannot be.
Work isn't the whole point of life, I-7. Seriously, you should enjoy yourself more.
Kanchou, what is there to enjoy? Even in the moments when I am saffingu, I am still but a humble warrior. Warriors who do not embrace battle are shamed.
I'm not talking about neglecting essential duties. I'm just saying there's no shame in letting yourself appreciate moments of peace.
You will upset the ancestors with your talk, Kanchou! I will hear no more of-
I-7, listen to me. Do you think my ancestors would want me to simply die an exhausted mess?
Work shall bring you splendor, Kanchou.
But it's not the only thing I'd want my friends to know me for. It's not what I love.
Uaaa..? Kanchou... My fun is with my... sword. It is with my sword and my sword alone! It... Hmph! We are here to defend the kami and ancestors.
Un. This is truth! .... Er, what are you staring at, Kanchou?
Look yonder. It appears we have some party crashers.
Mou ikkemasen! Come, Kanchou! Let us excise them!
@BATTLE
By the way, I'm really glad to see you in good spirits, I-7. To see you free like this a treat in of itself.
Actually, I don't mean to pry, but it occurs to me that I don't know what you do for fun - outside of festivals. Is there something?
Kanchou!!! Kanchou!!! Hah... Hah... There is a situation!
What? What's going on!?
There are... kodomo! Children!
Eh? ... Oh, there are a ton of them. What are they here for? Where are there parents?
I asked that question. There has yet to be a reply that does not involve alcohol.

Fields.MenuText: Parents of the century...
That's not safe. What do the kids want?
Oh, I-7, don't worry. We'll take care of them.

Fields.DialogueText: It is disgusting..! But there is nothing that can be helped for it! Aaaaahhh... What should we do? We cannot just leave them? Yet, the regulations are... Aaahh... Muzukashiyo!
Sansei desu yo! This is unprecendeted... Kururgh... Such things greatly anger me. That they'd leave children unattended! Dou shiyou? What should we do!? We cannot ignore it!
C-Can we!? Kuh... The Zenpan above shall have fits if they figure out that we are doing such things! Y-Yet we cannot leave them! Urghhh... This situation...! Kore...! What do we do!?
Hold on, I-7. I'll talk to them.
(The children all answer variously. But most of them express interest in I-7. They think she's pretty and would like to see something special.)
C-Chotto... Nani!?
I think I may have an idea, I-7. Do you have your sword at the ready? I have something that may help here. Huuuup!
Kanchou, is that a suika!? Where did you get that!?
Do you think you could slice this thing into ribbons if I threw it into the air?
... Ah! Kanchou... I see what you mean. All right. Throw it, and I shall subject it to 1000 cuts.
Okay, are you ready? Huph!
Hah! (*Sliceslicesliceslice!*) Hupt! Ooooooh! A perfect cut.
I'll say, it's in about enough pieces we need to give... Oh, they love it, I-7! All right, hold on! Kore! Iiko! Please take these watermelon.
K-Kanchou! A Morgana is headed this way! We need to get the children out of here!
Not so. This'll be the second part of your show, I-7. Children! Look! Miss I-7 shall now go into battle!
Kuh... Kakugo shinasai!
@BATTLE
Excuse me! Shitsureishimasu! What brings all of you here? Naze koko ni kita ka?
Kore de... owari da!!!
Let's get them!
@BATTLE
... Kitta! Ooooryahh! (*SLICE, SLICE, SLICE!*) Yami ni kieru!
That Morgana... sliced into four pieces.
(The children all begin to cheer and praise I-7 as the Morgana fades out... Their cheering only increases into a fever pitch along with praises of I-7's name!)
I-7, I've seen some amazing things in this war, but I haven't seen much that compares with that. Well done.
Waaa...? Uaaaah... Mou... K-Kanchou, hazukashi yo... (Captain, it's too embarrassing!)

Fields.MenuText: Nonsense. Bravo!
It's not embarassing, that was amazing!
Please, I-7. You're allowed to accept compliments, I promise.

Fields.DialogueText: Kururugh..! H-Hmph! Arigatou gozaimasu, arigatou gozaimasu. Truly I am not worth this praise, please... I am but a warrior serving under my Kanchou. Please. I...
I only did what was necessary to protect the children, nothing more! Arigatou gozaimasu... But, please! Save your praise for someone else, I did what I must! Please..!
Kanchou..! I-I cannot. I must remain humble! I may not accept praise, it is forbidden..! I... Uuuugh... Hazukashi... Mou, onegai..!
I-7, it's all right. Seriously, that was wonderful. You did it, all the kids are safe!
Y-Yokatta. I am rejoiced that these children are alright... Hm? Ah! The parents!
Be good, kiddos! Iiko! Tell your parents to watch out for you! Be good!!!
Kanchou... Thy handling of that situation was... exceptional. My praise is freely yours. Without your guidance, I am unsure what would've happened to the children.
We did it together, I-7. We both used our knowhow and quick-witted thinking to stop what would've potentially been a nasty situation. Well done, I-7.
A... Arigatou... Kanchou...
I-7, are you... crying?
Iie! I am... happy!
Aww, I-7... You did a great job.
Wow.
Ah, and so the festival is drawing to a close... Soon, they shall launch their spirit ships over the water and that will be that.
You want to check the canal just to make sure that we aren't missing anything?
Mochiron. You would call me a fool if I did not make sure...
Well, well. Radar's picking things up. What do you know?
I believe it is time that we lay this farce to rest, Kanchou. At least, for this endeavor. Kakugo wo ii ka?
Of course. Let's go.
@BATTLE
Omigoto, I-7.
T-You art praising me again..! Hmph! Arigatou gozaimasu... hm? Oh! Mitte, Kanchou! They're sending out the lanterns now.
Hm! How beautiful. Hopefully, the minister will be pleased. Thank you for helping me all this time, I-7. Shall we make a toast?
Kore wa... That's a rather fine bottle of sake. Where did you obtain that?
The parents gave it to me after those kids ran back. They apologized profusely and asked I take it.
They should apologize! Hah... Well, it's over now. The lanterns flickering in the dark remind me of happier times. But... as I look upon this river, I feel made anew, Kanchou.
I do, too, I-7. We are warriors now indeed.
Ay! But you still have much to learn, so do not slack off, or else my fury will be palpable! Do your best and I shall reward you with my loyalty.

Fields.MenuText: Here's to doing our best and to loyalty.
Maybe I'll earn more than just your loyalty, in time.

Fields.DialogueText: Pah! I shall watch you with great interest... (Kanchou... dost you really feel that?)
To loyalty, honor, and His Imperial Majesty.
Cheers!
Kampai!
Kampai! Omedetou gozaimasu!
